italic.text: To depollute or decontaminate in order to rehabilitate a site or a soil that has been polluted by industrial activities. The decontamination of a site reduces the risk of pollution to acceptable levels or make it disappear.

line.text: In SWORD, decontaminating a site ("contaminated site") prevents units from being contaminated. It prevents the creation and the dispersion of a contaminated cloud that can cause injuries in units. A "decontaminated site" in SWORD is defined by a surface delimited by a polygon. All contamination objects (such as "contaminated area") that intersect with the decontaminated surface lose their contamination capacity.

Areas (polygons) or urban blocks to decontaminate.

The agent moves toward each element to decontaminate (an area or a urban block) (the order of traversal is defined by user). If a visited element is reachable (the agents can enter it), the agent moves to the center, otherwise it moves to a close position (the position closest to the center).
Upon reaching an element (an area or an urban block), the agent decontaminates it before moving to the next unvisited element.
When there are no more elements to decontaminate, the agent stays next to the last visited element and the mission ends.
